docs.abstract: Qwest Communications International Inc files restated earnings for 2000 and 2001, saying it lost $2.54 billion more than initially reported in those years; restatement was prompted by 18-month federal probe into accounting practices by company (S)
docs.snippet: Qwest Communications International Inc. filed its restated earnings for 2000 and 2001 on Thursday, saying it lost $2.54 billion more than initially reported in those years.    The changes in company earnings reflect corrections to the improper man...
docs.lead_paragraph: Qwest Communications International Inc. filed its restated earnings for 2000 and 2001 on Thursday, saying it lost $2.54 billion more than initially reported in those years. The changes in company earnings reflect corrections to the improper manner in which the company recorded sales of capacity on its telecommunications network, as well as equipment sales, phone book publishing and purchase accounting methods.

docs.abstract: Ford is adding physical controls to its much-criticized MyFord Touch system, which some buyers had found difficult to use, in seeming admission that it pushed technology envelope too far.
docs.snippet: Ford is adding old-school buttons to its much-criticized MyFord Touch system, which some buyers had found difficult to use....
docs.lead_paragraph: Ford is adding old-school buttons to its much-criticized MyFord Touch system, which some buyers had found difficult to use.

docs.abstract: Artist Daan Roosegaard and infrastructure developer Heijmans are collaborating on array of quirky, interactive designs that could change way streets look and act; products include glow-in-the-dark road markings, interactive streetlights, battery-charging e-lanes and illuminated foul-weather warnings.
docs.snippet: Under a Dutch plan, “smart” roads would include glow-in-the-dark markings, interactive streetlights, battery-charging e-lanes and illuminated foul-weather warnings....

docs.abstract: Detroit has long been the epicenter of American automaking, but among the places vying to become a nexus of auto development is Fort Collins, Colo, which already is a leading engine and transportation research center.

docs.abstract: Tesla Motors has developed a new triple-layer underbody shield, including a titanium plate, in response to design flaws that caused fires in its Model S; titanium component turns out to be relatively small and unlikely to add significant weight or change car's range certification.
docs.snippet: The automaker’s “triple underbody shield” includes a titanium plate, but it does not turn the vehicle into an all-terrain tank....
docs.lead_paragraph: The automaker’s “triple underbody shield” includes a titanium plate, but it does not turn the vehicle into an all-terrain tank.

docs.abstract: Oracle says profit grew 12 percent in third quarter ended Feb 28; earned $571.3 million compared with $508 million year earlier; revenue rose to $2.31 billion from $2.25 billion (M)
docs.snippet: Oracle, the big software maker, said today that third-quarter profit grew 12 percent, its first year-over-year profit improvement since the November quarter of 2001.    Revenue edged up nearly 3 percent, but sales of new software licenses were dow...
docs.lead_paragraph: Oracle, the big software maker, said today that third-quarter profit grew 12 percent, its first year-over-year profit improvement since the November quarter of 2001. Revenue edged up nearly 3 percent, but sales of new software licenses were down, contributing to an after-hours sell-off that sent Oracle shares down as much as $11.70, over 4 percent lower than their close of $12.25.

headline.main: Oracle Posts A 12% Gain In Earnings

docs.abstract: Automakers are producing powerful but compact and fuel efficient 3-cylinder engines with help of turbo chargers; Ford's 52-pound 3-cylinder EcoBoost engine is small enough to fit in a suitcase.
docs.snippet: With the help of turbos, automakers are producing powerful but fuel efficient 3-cylinder engines. A Ford triple, as the engines are called, is small enough to fit into a suitcase....
docs.lead_paragraph: With the help of turbos, automakers are producing powerful but fuel efficient 3-cylinder engines. A Ford triple, as the engines are called, is small enough to fit into a suitcase.
